website_summaries.verdict: The best budget pair of road bike inner tubes. Comes with better features and performance than other budget options.
pros: Fits standard 700c road rims and most tire widths
Easy to put onto a bike rim in a short amount of time during an emergency or mid-race
Removable core stems for tube sealant
cons: Removable cores can pop off when working with the inner tube

customer_reviews.title: Removable Cores allow use of tubeless sealants!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cyclocross (CX) bike for both Road and Single Track trail riding. My rims and tires are Tubeless Ready (TR), but it is very difficult to get tires to seal on the rims without tubes. For this reason, I am forced to use tubes, which are prone to pinch flats if not inflated with higher pressures on trails.. The higher pressure greatly reduces traction. Using these tubes and some tubeless sealant allows me to run lower pressures and avoid pinch flats while being able to more easily change tires for road and trails.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Worthlessly short presta valve
customer_reviews.text: Why would you even take the time to make a product like this? Worthlessly short presta valve. Thanks for wasting my time. Turn your factory into an animal rescue center because you have no concept of the cycling products industry.
customer_reviews.author: KCitian

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones you want
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive-but-good inner tubes. Perfect. Unless you want super-lightweight latex tubes (more prone to punctures), you don’t need to spend more money on tubes. Invest in good tires, and buy cheap tubes!
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: They do what tubes are supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: These tubes do the job. Combined with some new Continental tires, I've been riding on them for over 100 miles so far. My only complaint is that, as other reviewers have mentioned, the valve body unscrews easily. The solution to this is to simply tighten them further before using them, as they are not tightened well enough at the factory. This is really quite easy to do and not really a concern. So far, so good, but I'll update my review in a few months as appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent box
customer_reviews.text: Masculine lines, seasoned texture. This boy's been around but he has it together... something about a box who can hold a worldview so tight, so comprehensive and know with unflinching, unneurotic certainty its place therein.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hakim

customer_reviews.title: Blows out near the valve stem.  Bang!  No fun at all!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two 5 months ago, held in reserve. Put the first one in my front tire before my ride today. (Old tube had a thorn hole, apparently). This tube blew after 3 miles, right near the stem, just like the other reviews. Put the second one in, rode home, gonna buy another brand before I ride again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Howser

customer_reviews.title: quick blowout
customer_reviews.text: After 12 miles suffered a blowout. Tried to inflate since I was 4 miles from home but it would be completely flat again within 50 meters. After the 4 mile walk home I looked at the tube and there was a 1 inch failure in the tube at the seam. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache, get the ones with the regular Schrader valve
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the ass to deal with, and no matter how much I tighten the Presta Valve screw, the air slowly leaks out every couple of days. Not worth the headache, get the ones with the regular Schrader valve, those do what they are suppose to do.... Keep air in your tire!!! The only reason I don't return them was because I waited too long because I hadn't used them yet. I bought them as a spare, so spare yourself some grief, and move on to the next one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joel J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: nozzle exploded at about 40psi
customer_reviews.text: went to use it to fill up a new bike tire, made it to about 40 psi, then the nozzle completely exploded. im just glad it broke at home instead of on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased As Spare Tubes
customer_reviews.text: My new Street Fit 360, 2 Pack - Bike Tube, Presta Valve 700c x 28-35, (27x1-1/8 to 1-1/4) will be there when i need them. The price was competitive and a quality brand. A definite buy/rebuy if necessary as far as i'm concerned!
customer_reviews.author: Truer Reviewer 2019

customer_reviews.title: Make sure valve stem is long enough
customer_reviews.text: Valve stem way too short. Useless for my purposes. My fault I should have researched a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Burger

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, one of the tubes had a hole in it before I installed it. Secondly, the stems on these tubes are too short. I could not use these.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Welch

customer_reviews.title: Sunline Inner Tubes
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased 4 sets of 2. Tested the inner tubes before storing them. No problems with any of them. Update: One inner tube that was in the spare parts bin was originally tested when it was purchased in 2019 then waited to be used had a seam failure after installing it 7/10/2020 and went for a ride of 13 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, I ordered two sets one for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, I ordered two sets one for my wife and one for me unfortunately I received the wrong size, I ordered 700c 28-35 I received 700c 35-40 kinda pissed since I'm using 28's on my bike... :/
customer_reviews.author: Raul Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: to remove the good tube so I could return them both
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to go with new tires for my road bike. First tube went in as expected but second tube was defective. This meant un-mounting the first wheel, and breaking the tire lose again, to remove the good tube so I could return them both. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Leaked Air
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was a fluke when the first one went flat after a two mile ride.... the second one last 12 miles. Waste of money! Ruined a day trip because I had to race home before the air was completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jacq Civitarese

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased this a couple of times and within a day or so both inner tubes have blown. Waste of money, get something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mabel

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beware they come 2 in a box. I now should be covered as I have 4 tubes.
customer_reviews.author: TEJ

customer_reviews.title: Great tubes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a so good price. This Sunlite tubes (made by Kenda) are great, just remember to tight well the valve core and you won't have any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Fabio Espitia

customer_reviews.title: Does the job very well.
customer_reviews.text: I have hit the curbs many times with this tube and it still holds well. Much better than the cheap bridgestone one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit
customer_reviews.text: When it says "Fits 28-35" they didnt. I ordered new 700-28 tires with the recommendation that these would fit and these tubes were too big.
customer_reviews.author: Diane David

customer_reviews.title: A bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Tubes are nice. A bit heavy, I believe more suitable for commute and recreational use than competition.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air from valve.
customer_reviews.text: I got like maybe 25 miles on one and it leaks air now. No punctures, i think it's from the valve. I guess the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: erick

customer_reviews.title: Good tube, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: The reason for not more stars is they are fragile and you need to take extra care installing to avoid punctures. I am hoping they hold air longer than my last set.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Rich

customer_reviews.title: Pay attainment to the presta valve lengths so they match your rims.
customer_reviews.text: Gotta make sure the presta valves are at the right length to come out of the rims.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to convert my Marin Bobcat Trail 29er mountain bike to an indoor trainer. I needed smaller tires to fit on the trainer without hitting the floor, which required smaller tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Presta valve IS NOT LIKE OTHER INNER TUBE air valves
customer_reviews.text: Whats a presta valve? You will need adapters to fill this tube. Additional required equipment is needed to get back on the road. Misleading ad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They keep the air on the inside where it belongs.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my 700mm x 32 cyclocross tyres. They work.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great value and nicely packaged!
customer_reviews.text: I installed one of these right away to go for a bike ride. Good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great happy to get my old cross country Dawes Bike back on the road!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so good!
customer_reviews.text: Installed one of these today. Inner tubes are as advertised. I will check back if I have trouble but I experienced quick delivery, decent packaging, a quality product, and a flawless installation. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: A. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Bsike
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered. Having just replaced tube in my bike it may be a while before I use these so can’t yet comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pinn

customer_reviews.title: Great Tube!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this so much. These usually last me a good 6 to 8 months specially with the road I ride on.
customer_reviews.author: David  MoralesTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Bike tubes
customer_reviews.text: Bike tubes. They keep me rolling down the road. Reasonable price and quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Evan C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Valves
customer_reviews.text: I got these tubes for my 28-630 (27 x 1 1/8 Inch) tires and they work nicely. I really like the fact that the valve cores can be unscrewed, it makes it a lot easier to put tire sealant in
customer_reviews.author: Seb

customer_reviews.title: good product for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Hand feeling on the tire tube is good and solid, the shaft of the Presta valve is 32mm, I like this length.
customer_reviews.author: John Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Valve core is removable so you can add tire sealant as needed.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Cozzens

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Decently constructed tube at an affordable price. You're probably kidding yourself if you think spending more on rubber tubes is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Slatford

customer_reviews.title: I could buy Bell brand 700c tube of better quality for a lower price at local Walmart store
customer_reviews.text: Found out after the fact, I could buy Bell brand 700c tube of better quality for a lower price at local Walmart store.
customer_reviews.author: spindoctor

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Air
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 tubes and all 4 were defective with a leak at the valve. The would hold air for 5-6 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Presta valve not secure
customer_reviews.text: The presta valves are horrible they are not secure to the stem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tubes for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Good tubes for cheap. Thicker than I originally expected based on the price and have been riding these regularly without a problem
customer_reviews.author: Heart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit and have worked for about a month so far!
customer_reviews.author: P. Reichert

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 isn't that bad is it?
customer_reviews.text: First tube was misshaped and didn't last long. Second one is fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ybarra

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price
customer_reviews.text: It's a bicycle tire tube. It holds air when pressurized. There's not much else to say about it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Woohoo!
customer_reviews.text: I can ride my bike again! Tube fit perfectly in my tires that require such a unique band. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Madison Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product at a good price, works exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Williamson

customer_reviews.title: broke almost instantly
customer_reviews.text: got 4, broke all on the first or second ride
customer_reviews.author: Oscar neson

customer_reviews.title: Tube leaked at a manufacturing joint
customer_reviews.text: One tube leaked at a pin hole in the manufacturing joint after two short rides.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Howe

customer_reviews.title: Better than stock, less than most
customer_reviews.text: When they talk about a removable core, I was surprised to find out that the whole asm is removable. No more losing that stupid little pin when filling it with goo. It allows for easy flow without worrying about the goo plugging up the stem.
customer_reviews.author: Psy

customer_reviews.title: Kept air in it well when it was off the ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept air in it well when it was off the tire, but was flat on my rim after a day of sitting. This is what happened to my last tube on the same wheel so I think my wheel is the culprit. Would not hesitate to buy again if I figure out what's up with my rim.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tire to keep on hand for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Have not needed to use this yet but it's a well built tire and folds down well to keep in a repair kit on my bike in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Kadsl

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy another one
customer_reviews.text: Product came in a timely fashion and worked as advertised. I bought 2 so that I'd have a spare in the garage ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie A Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Strong side walls.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was small and the product has preformed well.
customer_reviews.author: tbermel

customer_reviews.title: Leaks...
customer_reviews.text: After a month usage, the tire seems to be slowly leaking air on a daily basis. I ended up pumping before riding the bike each time.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: The part of the tube where the electronic igniter snaps ...
customer_reviews.text: The part of the tube where the electronic igniter snaps on to is not crimped properly so the igniter bracket would not reach the snap grooves. I had to make some sleeves out of pipe strap to hold the igniter bracket to the tube. If it wasn't for a family gathering BBQ in a couple of days I would of just returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Lou8700

product_meta.title: Street Fit 360 1 Pack or 2 Pack - Bike Tube, Presta Valve 700c x 28-35, (27x1-1/8 to 1-1/4), 32mm Presta Valve, Bicycle Inner Tube, Sunlite
product_meta.description: Bicycle inner tubes with PRESTA Valve. Sunlite tubes are high quality tubes at an affordable price. These tubes work on all brands and genres of bicycles. Verify the size you require. Replacement inner tube for road, recumbent, triathalon, mountain, single speed fixies, cruiser or any bicycle tire with the same tire dimensions. Be sure to verify the size of inner tube, valve type and length. Remember to always add a little air (to give the tube form) to the new inner tube before installing. This will prevent it from bunching up and/or causing a pinch flat or possibly blowing the tire off the rim (when you immediately and fully inflate) which ultimately will pop the tube.
feature_bullets: Please check the side of your tire or on your old inner tube for the proper size, valve type and valve length.

When changing your bicycle inner tube ALWAYS be sure to add just a little air to the tube before installing. This gives it form so it doesn't get twisted or bunch up which may cause a pinch flat. Once the new tube is installed and BEFORE fully inflating only add a few PSI to further form the tube. Inspect for an even bead of the tire to the rim on both sides.

Then, inflate to approximately half the desired PSI and re-inspect the tire bead to the rim again. If even beading all the way around on both sides then inflate to the recommended air pressure. This procedure is important because if the bead doesn't hook properly on the rim then as the inner tube is inflated it can sneak out between the tire and rim and then BOOM!
